Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on the Accuracy of Surgical Ward Round Documentation

Participants.evidence: adults admitted to surgical wards who could consent and comprehend English

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the accuracy of surgical ward round documentation.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the accuracy of Major discussion documentation.

Result_Outcome.evidence: 32.4% of Major discussion points were omitted from case notes, and 11% contained significant errors.

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration: Central Adelaide Local Health Network Human Research Ethics Committee (#12993).

Funding.evidence: The study was funded by the Avant Foundation Grant.
